summary: After spending years working in real estate and law firm offices, I felt that my skills were under-utilized and my work days left me feeling unfulfilled. Exploring other outlets, I soon found that coding gave me the sense of self-satisfaction I was looking for. Over the past year and a half, I devoted my full time to studying programming languages and software development. I have applied the knowledge I've acquired through online courses to create a variety of projects that showcase my skills as a self-taught developer, and hope to utilize these skills at a full-time position for a company looking for someone with self-motivation and drive!

roles.job: Title Closing Processor and Licensed Title Agent
tasks: Opened files for each new transaction, cash or finance, ordering both title and municipal lien searches.
Worked as part of a team consisting of both in-person co-workers and remote co-workers.
Examined title of  subject properties and worked on clearing every closing requirement needed for each, including probate and open permits/municipal liens.

experience.company: Gainesville Title, PLLC, A Law Firm

roles.job: Legal Assistant to Patrick Dodds, Esq.
tasks: Designed, implemented, and maintained a company workflow using Trello that greatly increased efficiency in the handling of files.
Reviewed real estate closing contracts and created new files in DoubleTime software, including ordering the title search.
Cleared title deficiencies, including ordering estoppel letters, payoff statements, and surveys.
Recorded warranty deeds, affidavits, mortgages, etc. in the Official Records through e-file.

roles.job: Legal Assistant to Robert J. Warren, Esq.
tasks: Collaborated with mortgage lenders to reconcile final settlement statements for real estate closings.
Maintained consistent communication with clients to ensure excellent customer service.
Processed screening and intake of bankruptcy clients and started their file in BestCase software.
Sat face-to-face with clients to guide them through their Chapter 7 bankruptcy petitions.

projects.name: Photo Caption Contest
projects.description: A Vue.js web application utilizing Node.js + Express, PostgreSQL, and Bootstrap in which users may register for an account to submit captions to various photos. WEBSITE COMING SOON.

projects.name: Pathfinding Visualizer
projects.description: Originally built using Python and Pygame, this is a pathfinding algorithm visualizer re-built with Vue.js and CSS. The algorithms include Breadth First Search, Depth First Search, and Bellman-Ford Algorithm. WORK IN PROGRESS.
